title: Images alternatives
description: Les images fournies sur cette page sont disponibles dans l'un de nos miroirs de confiance, mais ne sont pas supportées officiellement.

get-involved.heading: Get Involved
get-involved.body: As you download and use Rocky Linux, the Rocky Enterprise Software Foundation invites you to <0>be a part of the community as a contributor</0>. There are many ways to contribute to the project, from documentation, QA, and testing to coding changes for SIGs, providing mirroring or hosting, and helping other users.

isos.heading: What's the difference between the ISOs?
isos.body: Various installation images are available for installing Rocky Linux. Which image you need to download depends on your installation environment and use-case.

boot.heading: Boot
boot.body: Used to install the operating system from another source (such as a HTTP repository of the binary files). Can also be used to enter Rescue Mode.

minimal.heading: Minimal
minimal.body: Used to install the operating system from another source (such as a HTTP repository of the binary files). Can also be used to enter Rescue Mode.

dvd.heading: DVD
dvd.body: A full installation that contains the BaseOS and AppStream repositories and allows you to complete the installation without additional repositories. Installing Rocky Linux from the DVD ISO is the easiest and most common method of performing a standard Rocky Linux 8 installation.
